oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Evaluation of the Embryo Transfer Procedure Proposed by the International Embryo Transfer Society (IETS) as a Method of Controlling Vertical Transmission of Neospora caninum in Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Baillargeon, Paul
Fecteau, Gilles
Paré, Julie
Lamothe, Pierre
Sauvé, Roger
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Neospora caninum
vertical transmission
embryo transfer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: New infections by Neospora caninum in cattle occur primarily following vertical transmission, and there is no proven way to prevent it. The embryo transfer procedure proposed by the International Embryo Transfer Society (IETS) has been proven effective against transmission of many pathogens in cattle. The objective of this study was to determine the efficacy of the IETS embryo transfer procedure into seronegative recipients to prevent vertical transmission of N. caninum in cattle.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2001; 152
